context: No significant correlation between the chosen markers of inflammation and EBC NO2 − were observed. A correlation of EBC NO2 − with pulmonary or systemic inflammation is therefore not supported by our results. EBC NO2 − Normalized to Vt If EBC NO2 − truly reflects pulmonary distension, and if distension is greater in more severe lung injury due to derecruitment, the relation of EBC NO2 − and Vt (ie, EBC NO2 −/Vt [milliliters per kilogram of BW] ratio) should be directly correlated to the extent of lung injury. In support of this assumption, Figure 3 indeed demonstrates significant correlations of the continuous-parameter LISS with EBC NO2 −/Vt ratio (Fig 3, right; r = 0.84, p < 0.0001) as well as of the Pao 2/fraction of inspired oxygen (Fio 2) ratio (the continuous parameter of the AECC classification) with EBC NO2 −/Vt (Fig 3, left; r = 0.66, p < 0.0001). In contrast, no correlation of Vt alone with either LISS or Pao 2/Fio 2 was observed (LISS, r = 0.05, p = 0.77; Pao 2/Fio 2, r = 0.17, p = 0.32). Correlation of EBC NO2 − and BAL NO2 − In 10 patients in whom a BAL was indicated for microbiologic diagnosis, BAL NO2 − was determined and compared to EBC NO2 −. A significant correlation between both values was found (r = 0.79, p = 0.012).

The study explores the correlation between EBC NO2− and various parameters related to lung injury, including tidal volume (Vt). While significant correlations were found between EBC NO2− normalized to Vt and lung injury severity, the direct relationship between nitrite and inspiration function is not explicitly established, indicating a more complex interaction rather than a straightforward correlation.
